meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be cultivated.
meanings.sent1: The cultivability of the soil determines the success of the garden.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on the cultivability of the land to produce crops.
meanings.sent3: The cultivability of the backyard was so high that even the weeds grew quickly!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fertile ground, full of cultivability for new ideas to grow.
meanings.sent5: The cultivability of the field was evident in the lush greenery that covered it.

meanings.definition: The ability to be grown or developed.
meanings.sent1: The cultivability of the seeds was evident in the sprouting plants.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the cultivability of the project increased over time.
meanings.sent3: His talent had a cultivability that amazed everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The team's spirit had a cultivability that spread positivity to all members.
meanings.sent5: The cultivability of the idea sparked a wave of creativity in the group.
